title: Used to think Google maps was great.
text: I depended on google maps every time I needed to know how to get somewhere. Recently I was traveling toward Shreveport Airport and google maps led me to a casino in the downtown area away from the airport, then directed from the casino to the airport. This route was no way the fastest and safest route. It required a U turn between fast moving traffic and another to get back on a freeway I had already been on. Either google maps was paid to take me by the Casino or the app was hijacked by the casino. Either way it was a disappointment to be lead away from the airport. Luckily I had left extremely early so I could return the rental car and make my flight. Otherwise I could have missed my flight being taken somewhere I didn‚Äôt ask to go.

title: Major bug in new update
text: Major bug in new version of Google Maps. When using Google Maps for driving navigation, it now gives us brand new lock screen notifications of our upcoming turns in a big black banner that appears on our Lock Screen. However, if you tap on the black box to open up the Google Maps App, Google Maps asks you if you want to EXIT from your navigation! What the ‚Äî? No, we don‚Äôt want to exit from our navigation. We are trying to see the app!

title: Inaccurate titles

title: Google maps avoids highways
text: I don‚Äôt know why Google maps takes you around to every place to avoid a highway but it does. It will make you do a U-turn right when you are at the highway and make you go through developments on a longer route instead of taking the highway. The app is marked correctly to where it‚Äôs not telling the app to avoid the highways, but the app does what it wants and continues to get worse. I am at interstate 55 and it wants me to turn around and go back from where I came through developments in order to get to my destination, which is right off the interstate. this is unsatisfactory and seems to be happening to a lot of people.

title: Puerto Vallarta is excellent, hotel is meh
text: The location and beach were chef‚Äôs kiss.  The hotel is older and looks it. If you stayed at HR Cabo you‚Äôll be disappointed in the rooms at HR PV. Also, the constant borage of sales is the opposite of relaxing. Definitely go to Puerto Vallarta but do some research on other places to stay.

title: Native american land missing
text: Please add the missing native american lands/nations, the ones that aren't visible. And, make the ones you have be adequately labelled. Suggestions/requests: Make the gray that highlights them them be a more visible color/visual distinction. Label their names sooner in the zoom. MAKE THEM SHOW UP SOONER IN THE ZOOM. better yet, make them *always* show up, the same way other nations/countries are always labeled when you zoom out far enough. I am not native, but I demand accurate showing of who's land is who's. Also it's quite useful information at times, such as what laws you are under for driving permits, what level of respect to have for certain things, if the land you are on is public or not, etc. Thank you!!!! Please participate in doing the right thing both for ALL USA citizens & travelers, but also for the people who we as invaders have so horrendously mistreated.

title: Viewing Photos is like an April Fools Joke
text: One of the best parts of google maps is the collection of photos and reviews. The mobile app displays these photos in an ‚Äúinstagram story‚Äù esque display where tapping on either side of the screen immediately takes you to the next or previous photo, instead of a swipe. It also automatically advances to the next picture after a while. This is exceptionally funny, and also a terrible way to view photos where you are trying to figure out details of a particular establishment.
